isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - GENERAL INFORMATION - DRI-LOC FASTENERS AND ROCKWELL LIQUID ADHESIVE 2297-C-7049 OR LOCTITE 680 OR EQUIVALENT

svcproc.title: DRI-LOC FASTENERS AND ROCKWELL LIQUID ADHESIVE 2297-C-7049 OR LOCTITE 680 OR EQUIVALENT

step1.para: Clean the oil and dirt from threaded holes. There is no special cleaning required.
Assemble parts using the new Dri-Loc fasteners.

caution.para: Do not apply adhesives or sealants on new Dri-Loc fasteners or in the threaded holes. If other adhesives or sealants are used, the new Dri-Loc adhesive will not function correctly.

step1.para: Tighten the fasteners to the required torque value for that size fastener. Refer to the Torque Chart.

note.para: There is no drying time required for Dri-Loc fasteners.

svcsubproc.title: Installing Old Dri-Loc Fasteners Using Rockwell Liquid Adhesive 2297-C-7049 or Loctite 680 or Equivalent

step1.para: Clean the oil and dirt from threaded holes. There is no special cleaning required and it is not necessary to remove the old Dri-Loc adhesive from threads.
Apply four or five drops of Rockwell Liquid Adhesive 2297-C-7049 or Loctite 680 or equivalent to threaded holes. Make sure the adhesive is on the threads ( Figure 65).

figure.caption: Figure 65. Apply Rockwell Liquid Adhesive or Loctite or Equivalent to Threaded Holes

caution.para: Do not apply adhesive to the fastener threads. Air pressure in the hole will push the adhesive out as the fastener is installed.

step1.para: Tighten the fasteners to the required torque value for that size fastener. Refer to the Torque Chart.

note.para: There is no drying time required for Rockwell Liquid Adhesive 2297-C-7049 or Loctite 680 or equivalent.

svcsubproc.title: Checking the Torque Values Of Dri-Loc Fasteners Not Requiring Removal

note.para: If Dri-Loc fasteners do not require removal from components, check the fasteners for correct torque value as follows:

step1.para: Apply the MINIMUM amount of torque required for that size fastener. Refer to the Torque Chart. The fastener MUST NOT rotate.

If the fastener rotates any amount, remove the fastener from the component. Inspect the fastener and the hole for wear and damage. Repair as necessary. If the fastener and the hole are in good condition, apply adhesive to the threaded hole. Follow the procedure for installing old Dri-Loc fasteners.

svcsubproc.title: Removing the Dri-Loc Fasteners
svcsubproc.para: If it is difficult to remove Dri-Loc fasteners from components, the strength of Dri-Loc, Rockwell adhesive or Loctite 680 or equivalent can be decreased by heating. Use the following procedure:

step1.para: Heat the fastener for three to five seconds ONLY and try to loosen the fastener with a wrench. DO NOT use an impact wrench to loosen the fastener or hit the fastener with a hammer.
Repeat step 1 until the fastener can be removed.

caution.para: Do not exceed 350°F (+177°C) maximum. Heating must be done slowly to prevent thermal stresses in the other components.
